는은.definition: placed after a word to indicate that it is the topic of a sentence

이가.definition: placed after a word to indicate that it is the subject of a sentence

를을.definition: placed after a word to indicate that it is the object of a sentence

에.definition: placed after a word to indicate that it is a destination or a time at which something takes place

없다.definition: to not exist, to not have

맛없다.definition: to be disgusting, to not be delicious

재미있다.definition: to be fun, to be funny, to be interesting

재미없다.definition: to not be fun, uninteresting, unenjoyable

많다.definition: to be many, to be a lot

도.definition: too, as well (at the topic level)

보다.definition: to see, to watch, to look at, to try

개.definition: things, objects, something with no specific counter or whose counter is unknown by the speaker

아저씨.definition: older man not related to you

아주머니.definition: older woman not related to you

보고싶다.definition: to miss (a person), lit. to want to see

받다.definition: to get, to receive, to acquire

아프다.definition: to be sick, to be sore

과2.definition: lesson numbers (but not total number of lessons)

구경하다.definition: to see the sights, to look around

들어보다.definition: to listen, lit. to try listening

놀다.definition: to play, to hang out with

퇴근시간.definition: time to get off of work

예습하다.definition: to study in advance (e.g. before class)

그만두다.definition: to stop, to give up, to quit

주중.definition: on weekdays, during the work week

학원.definition: private educational institute, academy, cram school

알리다.definition: to let someone know, to inform

뚱뚱하다.definition: to be fat, to be chubby

마르다2.definition: to be too thin (for a person)

오래되다.definition: for an object to be old

딱딱하다.definition: to be hard, to be rigid

잡다.definition: to catch, to grab, to hold

내다.definition: to pay for, to hand in, to give
